location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.193 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the Bahrain chief's planned aggression against his relations on the island of Kenn [Kish]. Kemball reports that he has learnt that Sheikh Muhammad bin Khalifa and his brother Sheikh Ali, have decided against invading Kish. The letter has two enclosures. The first is a translation of a letter (folio 38) from Sheikh Ali ben Khuleefa [Ali bin Khalifa] to Kemball, dated 15 June 1853. The second is Kemball's reply to Sheikh Ali bin Khalifa, a translation of a letter (folio 39) dated 21 June 1853.
